| **[Reference](/wiki/Source_code "Source code")**                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                          | [SLASH'EM 0.0.7E7F2/monst.c#line1800](/wiki/SLASH%27EM_0.0.7E7F2/monst.c#line1800 "SLASH'EM 0.0.7E7F2/monst.c") |

An **arc bug**, x, is a type of [monster](/wiki/Monster "Monster") that appears in [SLASH'EM](/wiki/SLASH%27EM "SLASH'EM"), [SpliceHack](/wiki/SpliceHack "SpliceHack"), [SlashTHEM](/wiki/SlashTHEM "SlashTHEM"), and [Hack'EM](/wiki/Hack%27EM "Hack'EM"). It is a stronger type of [electric bug](/wiki/Electric_bug "Electric bug") with a more powerful bite that inflicts [shock](/wiki/Shock "Shock") damage and can destroy [rings](/wiki/Ring "Ring") and [wands](/wiki/Wand "Wand").

In SLASH'EM and SlashTHEM, arc bugs [hit as a +1 weapon](/wiki/Hits_creatures_as_%2Bx_weapon "Hits creatures as +x weapon"). In SpliceHack, arc bugs are restricted to orthogonal movement like grid bugs.

## Generation

Arc bugs are always generated hostile, and appear in small [groups](/wiki/Group "Group"). They are not randomly generated in [Gehennom](/wiki/Gehennom "Gehennom"). An arc bug [does not leave a corpse](/wiki/Corpseless "Corpseless") upon death.

[Spark bugs](/wiki/Spark_bug "Spark bug") can [grow up](/wiki/Grow_up "Grow up") into arc bugs, and arc bugs can grow up into [lightning bugs](/wiki/Lightning_bug "Lightning bug").

## Strategy

As with spark bugs, the rarity of early [shock resistance](/wiki/Shock_resistance "Shock resistance") sources makes it important that you protect any loose rings or wands in your inventory when encountering groups of arc bugs. Remember that on top of item loss, wands that explode from shock in SLASH'EM and its variants have the same effect as [breaking wands](/wiki/Breaking_wands "Breaking wands"), making them far more likely to be detrimental [or even lethal](/wiki/YASD "YASD"). Acquiring a [sack](/wiki/Sack "Sack") or [oilskin sack](/wiki/Oilskin_sack "Oilskin sack") is generally higher priority as a result.

Arc bugs should be dealt with quickly by early-game characters, as their bites can deal decent damage even without destroying items.

## Encyclopedia entry

"What was that?" cried Buck, rubbing his numb and tingling arm.  
"Nature's revenge for bug zappers," replied his companion.

[![This article may require revision for the next version of SLASH'EM. Click here for more information.](/images/3/38/Se7e7-icon.png)](/wiki/NetHackWiki:Next_version "This article may require revision for the next version of SLASH'EM. Click here for more information.")

[![This article describes a 3.4.3-based variant of NetHack. Click here for more information.](/images/5/5d/Nh343var-icon.png)](/wiki/NetHackWiki:Next_version "This article describes a 3.4.3-based variant of NetHack. Click here for more information.")
html:
Arc bug

From NetHackWiki
Jump to navigation Jump to search
x arc bug
Difficulty 6
Attacks Bite shock 2d4
x arc bug
Difficulty 6
Attacks

Bite shock 2d4

Base level 4
Base experience 45
Speed 12
Base AC 9
Base MR 0
Alignment 0 (neutral)
Frequency (by normal means) 1 (Very rare)
Genocidable Yes
Weight 15
Nutritional value 10
Size Tiny
Resistances shock, poison
Resistances conveyed None

An arc bug:

  • is an animal.
  • does not eat. (*)
  • is normally generated hostile.
  • can be seen through infravision.
  • does not appear in Gehennom.
  • normally appears in small groups.
  • never leaves a corpse.
  • hits creatures as a +1 weapon.
Reference SLASH'EM 0.0.7E7F2/monst.c#line1800

An arc bug, x, is a type of monster that appears in SLASH'EM, SpliceHack, SlashTHEM, and Hack'EM. It is a stronger type of electric bug with a more powerful bite that inflicts shock damage and can destroy rings and wands.

In SLASH'EM and SlashTHEM, arc bugs hit as a +1 weapon. In SpliceHack, arc bugs are restricted to orthogonal movement like grid bugs.

Generation

Arc bugs are always generated hostile, and appear in small groups. They are not randomly generated in Gehennom. An arc bug does not leave a corpse upon death.

Spark bugs can grow up into arc bugs, and arc bugs can grow up into lightning bugs.

Strategy

As with spark bugs, the rarity of early shock resistance sources makes it important that you protect any loose rings or wands in your inventory when encountering groups of arc bugs. Remember that on top of item loss, wands that explode from shock in SLASH'EM and its variants have the same effect as breaking wands, making them far more likely to be detrimental or even lethal. Acquiring a sack or oilskin sack is generally higher priority as a result.

Arc bugs should be dealt with quickly by early-game characters, as their bites can deal decent damage even without destroying items.

Encyclopedia entry

"What was that?" cried Buck, rubbing his numb and tingling arm.
"Nature's revenge for bug zappers," replied his companion.

An '''arc bug''', {{monsym|arc bug}}, is a type of [[monster]] that appears in [[SLASH'EM]], [[SpliceHack]], [[SlashTHEM]], and [[Hack'EM]]. It is a stronger type of [[electric bug]] with a more powerful bite that inflicts [[shock]] damage and can destroy [[ring]]s and [[wand]]s.

In SLASH'EM and SlashTHEM, arc bugs [[Hits creatures as +x weapon|hit as a +1 weapon]]. In SpliceHack, arc bugs are restricted to orthogonal movement like grid bugs.

==Generation==
Arc bugs are always generated hostile, and appear in small [[group]]s. They are not randomly generated in [[Gehennom]]. An arc bug [[Corpseless|does not leave a corpse]] upon death.

[[Spark bug]]s can [[grow up]] into arc bugs, and arc bugs can grow up into [[lightning bug]]s.

==Strategy==
As with spark bugs, the rarity of early [[shock resistance]] sources makes it important that you protect any loose rings or wands in your inventory when encountering groups of arc bugs. Remember that on top of item loss, wands that explode from shock in SLASH'EM and its variants have the same effect as [[breaking wands]], making them far more likely to be detrimental [[YASD|or even lethal]]. Acquiring a [[sack]] or [[oilskin sack]] is generally higher priority as a result.

Arc bugs should be dealt with quickly by early-game characters, as their bites can deal decent damage even without destroying items.

==Encyclopedia entry==
